intro: Viola italica, commonly known as the heartleaf viola, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that come in a range of colors including purple, blue, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. Viola italica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to bloom in early spring. It is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of edible flowers.
